turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Why do you ask?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: No, it's just weird with him being such a brain and all, I just wondered if he was ever able to remember stuff he'd forgotten.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: When he was around your age... almost exactly your age. He said he figured out a trick to remember the past.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: I couldn't tell if they were real memories or just phantoms. You know, he might only have thought he actually remembered them...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: And then, just before it got so bad that he had to be committed, he said that he could...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What? What could he do?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: ...I spoke to your new lawyer about the appeal. He's sure he can get you off on self-defense, so if you're patient.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: How long will I be in here?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: I don't know. These things take time.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: How's Kayleigh doing? She all right?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: I found these. The others are still in storage.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Damn it, Mom. I told you I need them all!

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Fine. You'll get them, Evan. But I think it's far more important to focus on your case right now.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Okay, doc. What's the damage? How much time have I got?

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Cute, Evan.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: What does that mean for Evan?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: He's saying it's like forty years worth of new memories have been jammed in my brain since last year. Overload city. 'Sat about the gist of it, doc?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: There must be a way to fix this.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Fix?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I just need the entry about the blockbuster. Wait, shit, no arms. I never even got the chance to write it.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: You're. Acting. Like your father.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Come on, Mom. Just 'cause Dad was my age when he started going crazy doesn't mean that I'm nuts.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: How. Did you. Know that?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: You told me that on Parents' Weekend. Remember? Wait, that wasn't me. Or you.

turns.speaker: ANDREA
turns.text: Just. Like. Jason.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Don't worry. I'm gonna get you out of here.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Best not bitch up. Wind up someone's luggage that way.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Can you protect me?

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Jesus himself couldn't make me take on the Brotherhood. When they come, just put your mind in another place, man. Be somewhere else.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: You're religious Carlos, you believe that bit about "the Lord works in mysterious ways?"

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Straight up.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Because I think he sent me to your cell on purpose. For you to help me.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Shit. I knew you were crazy.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I ain't bullshitting. Jesus speaks to me in my dreams.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: So when I'm out, I need you to watch my face and hands closely.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: You need to see the prison shrink, man.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Just tell me if anything weird happens.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Weirder than this?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Marks, scars, I dunno. Anything could happen I guess.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What did you see? What did it look like?

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Signs of the Lord. They just appeared out of nowhere. I thought you were loco!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: So you believe me?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Hello, Evan. It's very nice to meet you.  He's as handsome as his father.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: You know my father?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Dad lives here?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Not in this wing, actually. No.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Now I want you to go back to the time you were in the woods with Lenny. Think of it like a movie. You can pause, rewind, or slow down any details you wish. Understand?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Where are you now?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I'm standing next to Kayleigh, my hands are over her ears.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Are you hurting her?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: No, protecting her.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Okay. Then go a little forward in time. What do you see now?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I see a car.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Go on. Nothing can hurt you. Remember, this is only a movie. You're completely safe.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I can't... the car vanishes and all of a sudden I'm on the ground in the woods.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: The car doesn't vanish Evan. The movie in your head has broken, that's all. But now I've re-spliced it and I want you to tell me about the car.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: It's coming... argh! I can't!

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: It's a little complicated. I haven't seen results exactly like these before.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Are you sure? Not even with my father?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: This is where we're finding most of the hemorrhaging. The outer lining of the cerebral cortex.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Lemme guess. Would that be where the memories are stored?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Hey, Evan. What's the big rush? We don't meet for another hour.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Where are my goddamn books?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Books?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: My journals! Where are they?

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: Think Evan. You've invented a disease that doesn't exist. Alternate universes with colleges, prisons, paraplegia...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: But I... I need those books.

turns.speaker: DR. REDFIELD
turns.text: You remind me of your father. He always screamed for a photo album even though he never had one.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Photos?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Get dressed, Thumper, you're taking me out for my birthday.

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: I thought you were a December baby.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: This is bigger. Seven years to the day. No blackouts.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: It's an experiment with flatworms and a maze. You take a flatworm and run it through the maze until he's memorized it. Then you put a new flatworm in the maze. He's clueless. Banging into walls, getting lost, whatever.

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: Like Ozzy.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Just by absorbing the first worm into its cellular structure, it gets all of the worm's memories.

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: That's probably why Hannibal Lecter's so smart.

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: You really think he wanted to kill you?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: All I know is that I might be able to unblock some of my repressed memories.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I never wanted to be in the movie anyway and it was cold so I wanted to wear my clothes but Mr. Miller took his shirt off --

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Shhh! I need quiet for this.

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: Are you stupid or what?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: Shucks, I dunno. But maybe there's a reason why you've repressed the one day when some old lecher had you in your tighty whities, dammit!

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: Whasamatter? Lost your Rolex?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: Fuck off, frat boy.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Get out. Both of you.

turns.speaker: THUMPER
turns.text: Sorry, dude. Just figured it'd be okay with you bein' sick and all.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: We should go soon. If Dad catches us smoking down here, we're dead.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: So let's go. This place creeps me out.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Oh God... what did we do?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Shit, Lenny. What's happened to you! We've gotta get help!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I'm sorry Kayleigh. This was a bad idea.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: You really don't remember anything that happened?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Ouch.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: It's not your fault. Mrs. Kagan called dad and blamed us for what happened to Lenny.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Damn. Your dad did this?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I deserve a lot worse.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What are you talking about? What you deserve is a better brother and father. All they do is make you feel like shit.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I can't believe Tommy's still pissed at me. He knows I'm moving away, right?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: He's been acting real strange lately. He won't even look me in the eyes anymore.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Duck, here they come.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Did your mom say if Lenny was... okay?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: He must be. They're letting him go, right?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Welcome home. Thought you might like some fresh air for a change.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Hi, Lenny.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: God, Evan! I never thought I'd see you again. How've you been?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Oh, comme si, comme ca, you know...

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: No, Evan. I don't know. It's been a long time. Fill me in.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I'm going to State now. Things are going okay. I guess. Mom's good...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Not since we were kids.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I've stopped a hundred times.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: So how's Tommy?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: They kept him in juvy for a few years. Now he works over at Dale's Autobody.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: No. I emancipated myself when I was fifteen.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Wow. That must've taken some courage.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Not if you remember my dad.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Couldn't you have moved in with your mom?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: She had a new family. Not enough space for me. Said I should have moved in with her when we were kids. But... whatever.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Actually, Kayleigh, the reason I came back to town was to talk to you.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Me? Are you kidding? Why?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Remember when I was a kid I had all these blackouts?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Well, lately some of the memories have begun to come back and I'd kinda like to talk to you about one of them in particular. It'd be a big help.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Well, sure. I'll try to remember. Shoot.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: When we were kids. Your dad was making a movie. Robin Hood or something?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: What do you want to know, Evan?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: It's just... did he... what happened in the basement?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: It was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I know, but...

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Is that why you came all the way back? To ask a lot of stupid questions about Robin Hood?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: No, but I think something really bad might've happened to us.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Just shut up, Evan. You're wasting your breath.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: You can't hate yourself just because your dad's a twisted freak.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Who are you trying to convince, Evan?! You come all the way out here to stir up my shit just because you had a bad memory!? You want me to cry on your shoulder and tell you that everything's all better now? Well fuck you, Evan! Nothing's gonna be all better! Okay?! Nothing ever gets better!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Jesus, Kayleigh, you're...  Incredible.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Mmmm... You give good compliment. Clean up and come back to bed.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Where... where are my clothes?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Those are your clothes, silly.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Hey, uh, don't go freaking out on me over this, but do you remember when your dad first got his video camera?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Well I remember he had one... but he, like, put it away after the first day. Why would that freak me out?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I dunno.  Just being weird.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Oh my God, that was good. Where'd you learn all those new tricks?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: So it didn't feel... weird?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Yeah, if you call multiple orgasms weird.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What do you think it is about us that makes us so perfect? Like, looking back, whatever gave you the nerve to sneak out and visit me after I moved away?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: As if my dad could've stopped me from seeing you. What's he gonna do to me?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I don't understand, where are you taking me?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: You'll see.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I don't know what to say. It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Go on. Sit down.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Why are you doing all this for me?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Simple math. When I woke up this morning and saw your smile... I knew that I wanted to spend the rest of my life with you.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: It's my fault. I should have told you he was released a few weeks ago.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Might'a been nice.  Like this is gonna do any good. Maybe one of the frat guys has a gun.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Please, Evan. Don't even joke. He wouldn't hurt you. He's just trying to scare you away from me.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Yeah, right. Tell that to Crockett.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: It's not his fault, Evan. You knew how bad he had it when we were kids.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Don't give me this Oprah-book club bad upbringing shit, because you turned out fine.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: My father never laid a hand on me. It's like the prick saved it all up for Tommy.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: It's just... you've been acting kinda strange, you know?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Like how?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I don't know. You seem... different. You make weird jokes. Your accents changed. You don't even walk the same.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I walk differently?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I can't put my finger on it, but everything's a bit off. Even the dinner tonight. It was beautiful, but...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I know I've been actin strange lately. It's just that... I don't want anything to happen to us.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Wait. Something's not right. Isn't that your jacket?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Evan, stop! You're gonna kill him!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: He's a fucking maniac!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I want you to take this, Lenny. Today's your day of atonement. I know how guilty you feel about that woman and her baby --

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Evan. Stop it. It's not the time.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Now's the only time!  Today you get a chance to redeem yourself. Start over with a clean slate. Tabula rasa --

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Oh, I thought you were my eight o'clock. Make it fast, I'm expecting someone.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Nice to see you, too. Can I come in?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: So how's tricks? Sorry, occupational humor.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I get it. You can drop it now.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Does my line of work make you uncomfortable, precious?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: No. Just that you need to hurt me with it. I've been where you've been.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Ha! Where's that?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: The bottom. When you're just a piece of meat waiting for the next attack.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: What's happened to you?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: You wouldn't believe me. I mean, people always say, "You wouldn't believe me", but in this case, it's not even worth trying.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I've seen some sickening shit. I don't blink twice anymore, especially in your case.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Because you're... different.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Different? How?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Let me ask you a question. Just a little one that's been gnawing at me for years.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: On the bridge. How did you know that Tommy had your dog? That was no fucking hunch.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Do you remember when I was a kid and I had those blackouts?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: You're right, Evan, I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I never thought you would. That's why I've never bothered to tell a soul until now, and why I never will again.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: I'm the only person you've told? That's a great line. Does that make other girls swoon? Do they actually eat up this bullshit?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I couldn't give a shit if you believe me or not, and frankly I'm too tired to prove it to you.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Oh? There's proof now?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Shit. I dunno. How would I know about the twin moles on your inner thigh?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Anyone with fifty bucks could tell you that.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Then forget that. How about... you prefer the smell of a skunk to flowers, you hate cilantro because for reasons unknown to you, it reminds you of your step-sister.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I just thought you should know.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: That I didn't leave you there to rot.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: There's one major hole in your story.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Which is?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: There is no fuckin' way on this planet or any other that I was in some fuckin' sorority.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Sure you don't want your wallet?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Don't think I'll need it where I'm going.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Off to change everyone's life again, is that it? Maybe this time you'll pop up in some mansion while I wind up in Tijuana doing the donkey act.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I'm over it. Whenever I try to help anyone it all turns to shit.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Well, don't give up now, Slick. You've already done so much for me. Hell, why don't you go back in time and save Mrs. Halpern and her baby. Then maybe Lenny wouldn't freak out and ruin my family.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: We have to get you to Sunnyvale. You're having one of your famous hemorrhages.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Stop! Take me back!

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: You know how spiritual he's gotten ever since he saved Mrs. Halpern and Katie.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: He saved Mrs. Halpern? Please, the twisted fuck.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Is something the matter?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Yeah, I think I gotta get these fixed or something.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Kayleigh? Do you ever think about "us?" I mean, wonder if it could ever have been different between the two of us?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Sure, Evan, why not? You were the first person I really ever cared about.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I was?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: That's why when I was little I never went to live with my mother.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: When my folks split, they gave me and Tommy a choice who we wanted to live with. I couldn't stand my dad, but I knew if I moved to my mom's I'd never see you again.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I never knew that. So then you still sometimes think of us... together?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: It's crossed my mind from time to time.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: And...?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Well a lot of things cross my mind. I've always been a fast thinker, Ev. I can play out the movie of our entire lives in under a second. Boom -- we fall in love -- get married -- two kids, your keen analytical insight matched to my generous nature -- kids grow old as do we, relatively stable relationships, matching burial plots, the whole bit. It took a lot longer to spit out than to imagine.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Then you think it might have worked out?

turns.speaker: KAYLEIGH
turns.text: Why not? But that's not how things wound up. I'm with Lenny, Lenny's your friend. And there it ends.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: We're really gonna be in a movie!?

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: That's right, Evan, and you get to be the star.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Where am I? What happened? Where did we all go?

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: Calm down, kid. Stand still.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I was just somewhere else -- how did I get here?

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: Quit acting like some retard or I'll call your mother and tell her what a naughty little shit you've been.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Kayleigh? What happened?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: It's time for you to stand where the hell I told you.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Wrong answer, fuckbag. This is the very moment of your reckoning. In the next thirty seconds you're going to open one of two doors. The first door will forever traumatize your own flesh and blood.

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: What's happened to -- How are you doing that?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: It'll change your daughter from a beautiful child into an empty shell whose only concept of trust was betrayed by her own sick pedophile father. Ultimately, it'll lead to her suicide. Nice work, daddy.

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: Who -- who are you?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Let's just say you're being closely watched, George. Your other option is to get your porn off the rack and treat Kayleigh like... oh, let's say like how a loving father treats his daughter. Sound okay to you, Papa?

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: ...yes.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Listen close then, fuckbag. You screw up again and I swear I'll flat out castrate you.

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: Easy does it, Evan! Don't be a bad boy or I'll tell mommy you were naughty.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: And I'll tell the Child Protective Services about your kiddie porn endeavors. One step closer and I'll shove this up your ass!

turns.speaker: MR. MILLER
turns.text: That's dangerous! You could blow your hands off!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Been there, done that.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: It's okay. I won't bite. You've seen pictures of me, right?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Uh-huh. Mom says I have your eyes and your --

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Are you okay? You looked like you were somewhere else for a second there.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Look, Jason, I need some fast answers if I'm ever gonna fix what I've done.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: I was praying this curse would have ended with me.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: But it didn't. And now I need info to make things right again and you're the only one who can give it to me.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: There is no "right". When you change who people are, you destroy who they were.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Who's to say you can't make things better?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: You can't play God, son. It must end with me. Just by being here, you may be killing your mother.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Bullshit. I'll send you a postcard when I've made everything perfect again.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Evan, you're hysterical. You study for this?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: We'll find out soon enough.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Me neither.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: You're kidding. Are these the answers?!

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Damn, Evan, on the D.L.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Thanks. Wow. Hey, I want to do something really special for Kayleigh tomorrow. If I said I needed some help from you and the brothers...

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I'd say blow me. Get the pledges to do it.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I'm not sure. I might have gotten some stories mixed up. Did Pavlov condition his dogs to lick his nuts?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR CARTER
turns.text: Typical psych major. A complete wise ass. And how's your project coming? Still planning to change the way we humble scientists view memory assimilation?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Hey, I got no choice.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR CARTER
turns.text: Whoa! Didn't mean to scare you, Evan. Just wanted to know how the flatworms project was coming.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Oh, fine I guess. It's been kind of crazy lately with my mom coming up, so I haven't...

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR CARTER
turns.text: I know, I know. Who can think of worms when your libido's in full swing, right?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR CARTER
turns.text: Just don't drop the ball, okay?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I won't let you down, Professor Carter.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR CARTER
turns.text: Remember, everyone! Only two weeks until your science projects are due.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: I still owe you an essay from last week. Is there any way I could get an extension?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR CARTER
turns.text: And you are...?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Evan Treborn.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR CARTER
turns.text: The answer's 'no', Mr. Treborn. Now take a seat. The exam's about to begin.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: So what's the point?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Maybe if I can figure out how the memories of a simple worm function, it'll help me understand the complexities of the human brain.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Smells like sex in here.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Thumper had a busy afternoon.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: You're kidding. He's so... big.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Most guys tuck their porn under here, but all you have are... comp books.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Yeah. I've been keeping journals since I was seven.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Wow... read something.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Freeze! No "worm-boy". No "Mr. Worm," and no "Worm-Master-General!" Once you get a nickname like that you can't shake it. And I don't want everyone thinking I've got tapeworms coming out of my ass or something, okay?

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Deal. Now read me something.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Come on, go on...

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: It was like Tommy was possessed or something. There was a hate in his eyes that I couldn't really call human.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: It didn't feel like a dream.

turns.speaker: HEIDI
turns.text: Maybe because they never do.  So Don Juan, you pass out on all your dates?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Can... can... Can I have this?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Sure. I was gonna make a new one, anyway.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: That should buy you ten minutes at least.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Gee, thanks friend.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I couldn't cut the rope.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Yeah, good, what else do you remember?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Drop it or I'll slit your mother's throat in her sleep.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: You knew the whole time, didn't you?  When you put the blade in my hand, you knew something big was going to happen. Didn't you?!

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Y... yes. I guess I did.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Uh, we should be getting to class now.

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: Forget it. What's the point of Psych now? Tomorrow I could wake up as some dirt farmer in Bangladesh.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Are you sure you even packed it?

turns.speaker: EVAN
turns.text: My mom packed for me. I think she sent everything I ever owned. So we'll see.
